title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". The findings are outlined in Section 2. Congress finds that federal agencies have an obligation to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which established a Government-wide goal of awarding at least 3 percent of contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans each fiscal year. Progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans has been slow, and prime contractors are obligated to contribute to this goal. The public has a right to know if Executive departments and prime contractors are meeting this goal. The public has a right to know if Executive departments and prime contractors are meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This includes definitions for covered contractors and Executive departments. Reports to the administrator are required three months after implementation. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these businesses quarterly. The Small Business Act requires executive departments to report the percentage of prime contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans quarterly, along with contractor names and utilization goals for each contract. The Small Business Act mandates executive departments to report the utilization goals for subcontracting small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans for each contract awarded to covered contractors. The Small Business Act requires covered contractors to report the percentage of subcontracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the negotiated percentage goal for subcontracting small businesses in their contracts. The Small Business Act mandates covered contractors to report subcontracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the percentage of total contract value completed within a specific period. The Small Business Act requires covered contractors to report subcontracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans and the percentage of total contract value completed within a specific period. Additionally, the Administrator ranks Executive departments based on these criteria. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on the percentage of total contract value awarded to small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans. The percentage of subcontracts awarded by covered contractors to small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans is a key factor in ranking Executive departments. The Administrator will publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website containing information submitted by covered contractors regarding subcontracts awarded to small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator will publish a report containing information submitted by covered contractors on subcontracts awarded to small business concerns owned by service-disabled veterans, with rankings made by the Administrator. If national security is at risk, certain information may be withheld from publication. The Administrator will not publish information detrimental to national security on the website, and will update it quarterly. Additionally, an annual report on the progress will be submitted to Congress. The Administrator will submit an annual report to Congress on the progress of Executive departments towards meeting Government-wide contracting goals. The report will include whether the website contains the latest data reported to the Administrator. The annual report to Congress will include a statement on the website's data and a recommendation for a prime contractor recognized for progress in contracting with service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses. Congress recognized for progress in contracting with small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans.
